overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach focused on identifying daily seasonality in hourly data. Given limited historical data (only 4 days), the analyst prioritizes simplicity and practicality, opting for a straightforward averaging method over complex models. The process includes thorough data inspection, pattern recognition, and manual computation of hourly averages, with careful handling of timestamps and rounding conventions.
common_data_patterns: Consistent hourly patterns with magnitude variations
No missing values in historical data
key_insights: Daily patterns dominate forecasting due to limited 4-day dataset, making weekly seasonality unidentifiable
Hourly averaging effectively smooths daily variations while preserving the core diurnal cycle
Data completeness checks precede modeling to avoid unnecessary imputation
Forecast replication relies on repeating the computed 24-hour average pattern across all future days
Explicit rounding to 3 decimal places maintains consistency with input data format
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with strong emphasis on data exploration and practical constraints. Balances statistical awareness (seasonality detection) with pragmatic simplification due to limited data. Includes manual calculations and step-by-step validation but avoids advanced modeling techniques.
